In three sentences

Miami Dade has it's usual clubs, SGA and cultural clubs, etc. In addition to those, in Spring 2012 Homestead Campus added a Journalism Club to the list. The Journalism Club writes articles for the local South Dade News Leader and is very interested in getting it's members published. It's a great club.

Everyone. There are older people who are trying to start a new career, new students who are trying to get a cheap A.A. Degree, people who haven't been to school in a while and are trying to get their feet wet. Miami Dade is for everyone.

Yes! Definitely! The price for classes cannot be beat. It's half the price of a traditional 4-year college and there are great teachers and resources available. Miami Dade College is definitely worth the money.

There are a lot of on campus activities. The various school clubs are always having cultural festivals and gatherings on campus. They offer free food and drink and there is music; it's a truly fabulous time.

I've only eaten at the Homestead Campus but they have decent food. Because the college is not a live in school the cafe does not really carry anything more than a quick bite to eat; although, they have added a new Chick N' Grill restaurant in the cafe.
If I could I would put not applicable because there is no dorm life. Miami Dade College is a commuter college.

Many people think just because this is a 2-year college it's a breeze, well it's not. Your classes will force you to pay attention and learn. If you just want the to be able to say I'm going to college, Miami Dade is not for you.

Be early, early, early!!! Apply for financial aide early. Sign up for your classes early. Before you sign up for a class check the professor on ratemyprofessor.com trust me it works wonderfully. Don't procrastinate; just because this is mostly a 2-year college doesn't mean you can just slack off and not do anything. If you do that you will fail I promise. Get used books when possible and rent if you can, it saves a lot of money. Also, take advantage of the tutoring and labs and stuff. There are English tutors to help you with you papers, a Math Lab and, at least on Homestead Campus, an Open Lab for some of the science classes.
Miami Dade is amazing; the teachers are helpful and funny. Use ratemyprofessor.com it works. The campus is fun and there are a lot of activities throughout the year.

textAfterTable: Did enjoy being here The only aspect of Miami Dade that was enjoyable was the fact that showing up to class is optional 90% of the time. So, you can easily get other things done with your life.
